Name.BusinessNameLine1: EVANGEL UNIVERSITY OF THE ASSEMBLIES OF GOD

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: EDUCATION - Evangel University's mission is to provide opportunities for Assemblies of God individuals to develop academically and intellectually in an accredited Christian liberal arts educational program and to inspire them within a Pentecostal environment to develop spiritually, emotionally, and culturally in order to use their chosen careers to serve both God and humankind.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Code 3. EDUCATION -Evangel University's mission is to provide opportunities for Assemblies of God individuals to develop academically and intellectually in an accredited Christian liberal arts educational program and to inspire them within a Pentecostal environment to develop spiritually, emotionally, and culturally in order to use their chosen careers to serve both God and humankind.
IRS990.Description: CODE 3. There were 1735 Undergraduates and 220 Graduates enrolled in the Fall 2009 semester and there were 1632 Undergrads and 200 Graduates enrolled in the Spring 2010 semester. A total of 459 students graduated in the 2009-2010 school year.

TheBooksAreInCareOf.NamePerson: George Crawford VP Business and Fin

InvestmentsProgramRelated.Description: Assets Held In Trust By Others

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The University's collections include approximately 34,000 prehistoric Native American and Inuit artifacts. These items were restricted by the donor to be held by the University in perpetuity. The collections also include six original paintings. No collection items were sold or removed in 2010. These items are on display in the University's Art Gallery and at other secured spots in other buildings around campus. The Art Gallery is open to the public free of charge.

The University's collections include approximately 34,000 prehistoric Native American and Inuit artifacts. These items were restricted by the donor to be held by the University in perpetuity. The collections also include six original paintings. No collection items were sold or removed in 2010. These items are on display in the University's Art Gallery and at other secured spots in other buildings around campus. The Art Gallery is open to the public free of charge.
Used for Student Scholarships and Maintenance on Buildings.

Uncertain Tax Position in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards (FASB) Staff Position No. 48-3, the University has elected to defer the effective date of FASB Interpretation No. 48 (FIN 48), Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, until its fiscal year end April 30, 2010. The University has continued to account for any uncertain tax provisions in accordance with literature that was authoritative immediately prior to the effective date of FIN 48, such as FASB Statement No. 109, Accounting for Income Tax, and FASB Statement No. 5, Accounting for Contingencies.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Rev Prox 75-70 Sec 4:032(2) over 75% of our students are members of a sponsoring religious organization and the non-discriminating policy is stated in Evangel's printed material and on its web site.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: Evangel receives Pell, SEOG, Smart, ACG, Federal Teach Grant, College Work Study, EU Student Loan Program, and Perkins Loan Program.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Housing Allowance Under Ministry credentials. Club Dues for use as entertainment for contributors and others with business relations with the University.

The Executive Committee of the Board of Directors is provided a copy of the salary survey developed by the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities which includes comparative salary data for executive positions at similiar institutions. The Excecutive Committee then makes a recommendation to the full Board of Directors for any adjustment to the salaries of the six executive officers. The University salaries are generally in the mid-range of the institutions surveyed.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: The Industrial Development Authority of the City of Springfield MO

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Controller prepares the 990 return and then submits it to the VP of Business and Finance for review, then to the President for review, and then to the Board of Directors for their review. Comments and questions are directed the Controller and the VP of Business and Finance through-out this review process which are addressed and make if any the necessary corrections or explanations. The corrected 990 is then resent back through the review process. Once everyone has reviewed and approved the 990 after all comments and explanations have been made then the Controller will submit it electronically to IRS. After submission a hard copy and electronic copy is sent to the VP of Business and Finance.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Members of the Board of Directors and Executive leadership are requested to discuss in a meeting any potential conflict of interest involving business transactions he or she may have with the University according to the Conflict of Interest Policy.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Board of Directors is provided a copy of the salary survey developed by the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities which includes comparative salary data for executive positions at similar institutions. The Executive Committee then makes a recommendation to the full Board of Directors for any adjustment to the salaries of the six executive officers. Our salaries are generally in the mid-range of the institutions surveyed. All other employee pay rates are determined by a standard grid and progression process authorized by the Board of Directors.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents are available to members of the Governing Board and Officers of the University. Policies, such as the Conflict of Interest Policy, the Whistleblower Policy, and other operating policies are available on Campus Documents in Outlook and in the employee section of the University website. Financial statements are provided to the Governing Board, the sponsoring church, lenders, insurance companies, federal agencies, and to others upon request. Requests for financial statements can be submitted to the Business and Finance Department of the University. The University seeks to respond within 48 hours of receiving the request.

Part VIII Line 1c & 1f. Explanation for the difference in the amount from Tax Year 2008 to Tax Year 2009. In 2008 Evangel did not separate the major fundraising for Homecoming. After completing the 2008 return it was apparent that Evangel needed to keep record of its major fundraiser. So in 2009 the Homecoming revenue was recorded on Line 1c and the remainder of Contributions for the rest of the University is recorded on Line 1f.
